snippet: Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and BAE Systems will invest up to $170 million over three years on measures like changes in factory tooling or production lines.
abstract: Lockheed Martin and its suppliers Northrop Grumman and BAE Systems agree to invest up to $170 million of their own money to help lower high cost of new F-35 fighter jets.
lead_paragraph: Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and BAE Systems will invest up to $170 million over three years on measures like changes in factory tooling or production lines.

headline.main: Lockheed in Deal to Cut Costs of F-35s
headline.print_headline: Lockheed in Deal to Cut Costs of F-35s
